sentences: Kellelgi meie grupist läks homme koju.
context: The Estonian word 'kellelgi' is an adessive case form of the pronoun 'keegi' (someone). It indicates location or relationship in relation to someone. The '-lgi' suffix adds emphasis, suggesting that this applies to some unspecified person among others. This form is typically used when something happens to, for, at, or on someone's account, or when referring to something being located near or associated with an unidentified person.
